title: Thai red curry shrimp with green beans
directions: Add the oil to a large pan over medium heat. When hot, add the shallot. Cook for a few minutes until soft, then add the garlic and ginger. Add the curry paste and mix.
Increase the heat and add the coconut milk and broth. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer.
Add the tomato paste, fish sauce, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes. Cook, simmering, for 5-7 minutes.
Add the shrimp, green beans, lime zest and juice, and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the shrimp turns pink. Add the salt, and stir.
Remove the mixture from the heat and add the cilantro.
Sere warm over cooked rice. Garnish with additional cilantro if you’d like.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons fish sauce (or low-sodium soy sauce if you don’t have fish sauce)
1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tablespoons fresh chopped cilantro, plus extra as garnish
